data.event: Augusta was founded in 1832 by Joel Catlin and W.D. Abernathy, who was the village's first postmaster.

event.title: September 18, 1858, soon-to-be President Abraham Lincoln visited

data.event: On September 18, 1858, soon-to-be President Abraham Lincoln visited Augusta, where he gave a speech and stayed at the home of Elder James Stark.

event.title: 1864, another soon to be President James Garfield spoke

data.event: In 1864, another soon to be President James Garfield spoke in Augusta on behalf of Lincoln.

event.title: include William McKinley and Theodore Roosevelt in the fall of 1900

data.event: Other notable visitors include William McKinley and Theodore Roosevelt in the fall of 1900.
Every year in July, Augusta plays host to the Hancock County Fair.
